events.title: World Cancer Day Awareness Event
events.description: A global awareness day uniting efforts in cancer prevention, detection, and treatment. Expect informational booths and possibly a guest lecture.

events.title: Safer Internet Day Workshop
events.description: Promoting safer and more responsible use of digital technology, especially among students and young people. Includes tips for online safety.

events.title: International Day of Women and Girls in Science Celebration
events.description: Celebrates the role of women and girls in STEM and promotes gender equality in science and technology. Features guest speakers and networking.

events.title: Valentine's Day Mixer
events.description: A global celebration of love and affection, with traditions varying across cultures. This event will be a social mixer for students.

events.title: Random Acts of Kindness Day Initiative
events.description: Encourages spontaneous acts of generosity and kindness to brighten lives within the campus community. Look for various activities and prompts.

events.title: World Day of Social Justice Forum
events.description: Promotes fair treatment, equality, and social justice worldwide. Featuring a panel discussion with faculty and guest speakers.

events.title: International Mother Language Day Celebration
events.organizer: UC Berkeley College of Letters & Science
events.description: UNESCO's day to celebrate linguistic and cultural diversity and promote multilingual education. Includes readings and cultural presentations.

events.title: BHDSC Seminar: Transparency and Workflow Validation in Data Harmonization
events.organizer: Tufts CTSI (Collaborating with UC Berkeley Data Science)
events.location: Online via Zoom (details to be confirmed)
events.description: A seminar by Rebecca Batorsky, PhD, focusing on statistical modeling, machine learning, and analysis of complex biomedical and clinical datasets.

events.title: PARC Seminar: The Global Research Space as Collaborative and Performative
events.organizer: University of Bristol (Collaborating with UC Berkeley)
events.location: Online via Eventbrite (details to be confirmed)
events.description: Professor Simon Marginson discusses spatial relations and asymmetries in global research, including multipolarity and Anglophone hegemony.

events.title: First Thursday Seminar: The 1776 Marine Raid on Nassau
events.organizer: Naval Historical Foundation (Collaborating with UC Berkeley History Dept.)
events.location: Online via Zoom (details to be confirmed)
events.description: A seminar with Charles P. Neimeyer, PhD, discussing the first amphibious landing by American forces in 1776.

events.title: Japan Lecture Café Series: Japan-Europe Relations in a Shifting World Order
events.organizer: Ghent University East Asia Platform (Collaborating with UC Berkeley)
events.time: 3:00 AM - 5:00 AM PST (12:00 - 2:00 PM Ghent Time)
events.description: Lecture by Dr. Nanae Baldauff on defense, technology, and industry in Japan-Europe relations.

events.title: IMO Technical Seminar on Marine Biofuels
events.organizer: International Maritime Organization (Collaborating with UC Berkeley Energy Institute)
events.description: This seminar will enhance understanding of biofuels as a low-greenhouse gas marine fuel and facilitate sharing of recent operational experiences.

events.title: Black History Month Celebration: Film Screening of Sinners
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: Join curator Anpa'o Locke for a screening of Ryan Coogler's supernatural thriller 'Sinners' as part of a weekend-long celebration of Black filmmaking.

events.title: Matteo Mancuso: Route 96 Tour
events.description: Witness the incredible technique of guitar prodigy Matteo Mancuso as he brings his Route 96 Tour to Berkeley. Expect an evening of world-class musicianship.

events.title: Storm Large Performance
events.description: Musician, actor, and author Storm Large brings her electrifying presence to the stage with her unique blend of rock, jazz, and cabaret.

events.title: Nacha Mendez: Genre-Defying Sounds
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Chicanx Latinx Student Development
events.location: The Mystic (Off-campus venue, details on student life website)
events.description: Witness the genre-defying sounds of Nacha Mendez, a recipient of the New Mexico Governor's Award for Excellence in the Arts. Free performance.

events.title: Nadja: Moody Postmodern Vampire Tale Film Screening
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: A 4K restoration of this surreal cult horror film set in 1990s New York, where a vampire is pursued by a descendant of Van Helsing.

events.title: Sugar Island Film Screening
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: A film exploring a Dominican-Haitian teenager's journey into adulthood when an unwanted pregnancy leads her to discover her own power.

events.title: The Love That Remains Film Screening
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: Filmmaker Hlynur Pálmason explores the Icelandic countryside through the lives of an artist and a fisherman as they navigate their marriage.

events.title: My Father's Shadow Film Screening
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: This poetic debut explores the tender bonds between a father and his two sons in 1993 Lagos, set against a political crisis.

events.title: Natchez Documentary Screening
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: Suzannah Herbert's award-winning documentary captures the clash between history and memory in a Mississippi town reliant on antebellum tourism.

events.title: Opera on Screen Santa Fe: La Bohème
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts) / Santa Fe Opera
events.description: A free screening of Puccini's timeless tale set in 1920s Paris, preceded by a family-friendly presentation.

events.title: By Design Film Screening
events.organizer: UC Berkeley BAMPFA (Center for Contemporary Arts)
events.description: An absurdist body-swap comedy where a woman swaps forms with a designer chair and finds she is better liked as an inanimate object.

events.title: The Ten Tenors Performance
events.description: The celebrated Australian vocal ensemble returns for an evening of powerful ten-part harmonies and captivating choreography across various genres.

events.title: The Okee Dokee Brothers Family Concert
events.description: Bring the whole family to see the Grammy-winning folk and roots music duo, inspiring outdoor adventure and creativity.

events.title: UC Berkeley Men's Basketball vs. Stanford
events.description: Cheer on the Golden Bears as they take on their cross-bay rivals, the Stanford Cardinal. Conference play always brings intense competition.

events.title: UC Berkeley Women's Gymnastics Meet
events.description: Witness the athleticism and artistry of the Cal Women's Gymnastics team in a home meet. Always a spectacular event.

events.title: UC Berkeley Baseball vs. Opening Weekend Series
events.description: Kick off the baseball season with the Golden Bears' opening weekend series. Support your team at the ballpark.

events.title: UC Berkeley Softball vs. Tournament Host
events.description: Catch the Cal Softball team in action during a home tournament. Exciting games are guaranteed.

events.title: Creative Writing Workshop (March 2026)
events.organizer: UC Berkeley English Department (in collaboration with Create with Emma)
events.location: Berkeley Public Library (Downtown Branch - simulated location)
events.description: Over three weeks, make measurable progress on your writing project, with critique groups, feedback, and one-on-one instructor meetings.

events.title: Japan Lecture Café Series: Japanese-Belgium/Ghent Relations & Art Objects
events.organizer: Ghent University East Asia Platform (Collaborating with UC Berkeley)
events.time: 3:00 AM - 5:00 AM PST (12:00 - 2:00 PM Ghent Time)
events.description: Lectures by Prof. Anna Andreeva and Prof. Andreas Niehaus on Japanese-Belgium/Ghent relations and Japanese art objects in Belgium.

events.title: CSD Professional Development: Presence in Practice
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Social Welfare (simulated, based on similar event)
events.description: A professional development session exploring spiritual accompaniment and cultural diversity in practice, guided by Erick Niyiragira.

events.title: Global Design Thinking Workshop - March 2026
events.organizer: HPI d-school (Collaborating with UC Berkeley SCET)
events.time: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (approx, Fri 6th March online, then 12-18th March onsite/hybrid)
events.location: Online / HPI d-school (simulated for Berkeley participation)
events.description: Dives into human-centered design to address pressing global challenges, focusing on Sustainable Development Goals.

events.title: Japan Lecture Café Series: The Power of Spatial Poetics in Japan and Flanders
events.organizer: Ghent University East Asia Platform (Collaborating with UC Berkeley)
events.time: 3:00 AM - 5:00 AM PST (12:00 - 2:00 PM Ghent Time)
events.description: Lecture by Dr. Hera Van Sande discussing the power of spatial poetics in Japan and Flanders.

events.title: CDDF Workshop: Clinical Development Plans: Global Development and Strategies
events.organizer: Cancer Drug Development Forum (Collaborating with UC Berkeley Public Health)
events.location: Online / Brussels, BE (simulated for Berkeley participation)
events.description: A workshop focused on global development and strategies for clinical development plans in cancer drug development.

events.title: Storytelling2Win Public Workshop
events.description: A workshop to transform how you connect with your audience by understanding why some stories resonate more than others.

events.title: Global Lunar Eclipse Viewing Event
events.location: Lawrence Hall of Science / Online Stream
events.description: Observe the total lunar eclipse. Explanations of how a lunar eclipse works and what to expect to see.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Math, English, Cartoons
events.description: The first lecture in a Calculus 1 series, covering foundational concepts in an engaging style.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Unions, Intersections, Complements, Products
events.description: The second lecture in the Calculus 1 series, focusing on set theory concepts relevant to mathematics.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Review, Subsets, Equality of Sets
events.description: A review session and deeper dive into subsets and equality of sets in the Calculus 1 series.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Inequalities and Subsets
events.description: Further exploration of inequalities and subsets in the ongoing Calculus 1 lecture series.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Logical Implications
events.description: A lecture on logical implications, an essential concept in advanced mathematics.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Complex Numbers
events.description: Introduction to complex numbers and their fundamental properties.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Graphing and Complex Numbers
events.description: Continued discussion on complex numbers, focusing on their graphical representation.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Proofs, Conjugates, Modulus, Argument, Polar Form, Cartesian Form
events.description: A comprehensive lecture on various forms and properties of complex numbers.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: The Source of Euler's Formula
events.description: Exploring the derivation and significance of Euler's famous formula.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Factoring and Roots and Roots of 1
events.description: A lecture covering factoring polynomials and understanding roots, including roots of unity.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Factoring and the Fundamental Theorem of Algebra
events.description: In-depth look at factoring techniques and the implications of the Fundamental Theorem of Algebra.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Functions -- Injective, Surjective, Bijective
events.description: A lecture defining and differentiating between injective, surjective, and bijective functions.

events.title: Calculus 1 Lecture Series: Graphing, Bijective Functions and Inverses
events.description: Focus on graphical representation of functions, properties of bijective functions, and their inverses.

events.title: UC Berkeley Career Center: Spring Career Fair
events.description: Connect with employers from various industries seeking interns and full-time hires. Open to all majors.

events.title: Resume & Cover Letter Workshop
events.location: Career Center Workshop Room, 2110 Sproul Hall
events.description: Learn how to craft compelling resumes and cover letters that stand out to recruiters. Bring your drafts for feedback.

events.title: Interview Skills for Success
events.location: Career Center Workshop Room, 2110 Sproul Hall
events.description: Master the art of interviewing with tips and practice sessions for various interview formats.

events.title: Networking Strategies for Students
events.location: Career Center Workshop Room, 2110 Sproul Hall
events.description: Develop effective networking skills to build professional connections and explore career opportunities.

events.title: Graduate School Application Workshop
events.description: Guidance on navigating the graduate school application process, including statements of purpose and recommendations.

events.title: Thesis & Dissertation Writing Support Group
events.description: A weekly support group for graduate students working on their theses and dissertations, offering peer and expert advice.

events.title: Graduate Student Professional Development Series: Grant Writing
events.description: A workshop focused on developing successful grant writing skills for academic and research funding.

events.title: Intramural Basketball League - Playoffs
events.description: The exciting playoff rounds for the campus intramural basketball league. Come cheer on your favorite teams!

events.title: Yoga & Mindfulness Session
events.description: A relaxing session of yoga and mindfulness, open to all skill levels. Improve your well-being and flexibility.

events.title: Climbing Wall Challenge Night
events.description: Test your climbing skills and compete with peers in various challenges at the campus climbing wall.

events.title: UC Berkeley Library: Research Skills Workshop Series - Part 1
events.description: The first in a series of workshops designed to enhance your research skills for academic success.

events.title: UC Berkeley Library: Zotero Citation Management Workshop
events.description: Learn how to use Zotero to efficiently manage your citations and bibliographies for research papers.

events.title: UC Berkeley Library: Advanced Search Strategies
events.description: Master advanced search techniques to find specialized resources and information effectively.

events.title: UC Berkeley Library: Copyright & Fair Use for Students
events.description: Understand copyright law and fair use principles relevant to academic work and publishing.

events.title: UC Berkeley Student Org Showcase & Social
events.description: Discover various student organizations, learn about their activities, and socialize with members.

events.title: Campus Recreation: Outdoor Adventure Trip Planning Workshop
events.description: Learn essential skills for planning safe and enjoyable outdoor adventure trips, from hiking to kayaking.

events.title: Innovation & Entrepreneurship Speaker Series
events.description: Hear from successful entrepreneurs and innovators about their journeys and insights into building ventures.

events.title: Berkeley AI Research Initiative Seminar
events.description: A weekly seminar showcasing cutting-edge research in artificial intelligence and its applications.

events.title: Climate Change & Policy Forum
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy
events.description: Expert panel discussion on current climate change research, policy implications, and potential solutions.

events.title: Robotics & Automation Research Showcase
events.description: Discover the latest advancements in robotics and automation from student and faculty researchers.
